page.title: 01ST HELIER TO ST LAWRENCE
page.content: This block divides into 3 regions. The largest is{The North,}an area of farms and scattered housing .It is dissected by N-S valleys and spurs. The spurs contain main routeways into St Helier, the A8, A9, B27 and A10. Waterworks valley contains reservoirs, Bellosanne the R.R.B. and Vallee des Vaux remains unspoilt.{The SW} comprises St Aubin's bay and the { coastal strip from Bel Royal to West Park. The main feature is the dual-carriage-way of Victoria Avenue with Hotels, Cafes, Deck-chairs and Parks.{The SE}lowland encompasses the N region of the town of St Helier and includes housing, schools, the emergency services and churches. From the late 19th century the town spread radially and today housing proposals at La Pouquelaye (agricultural) are a matter of controversy.
